p: The percentage of blood sampling in 1,521 children in the 2015 cohort and 1,844 children in 2016 was 85% ( Fig 1). Ticul had the highest coverage (90.5%) of blood samples, Merida had similar coverages by risk areas (87%), while Progreso presented the lowest coverage (75.6%). There were 888 (68.3%) paired samples in children. Again, Ticul led the blood sampling with 79.3%, followed by Progreso (70%) and MÃ©rida (63.7%). ( S1 Table).
